page.title: 06MY DAY AS A SHIFT-WORKER
page.content: Most men in our area who do shift- work, work at Fords' Car Factory. We talked to two shiftworkers, who said that they work nights for two weeks and days for two weeks. They preferred to work nights because it was quiet and they could get on with their work better. They also felt that they had more free time during the day because they seemed to need less sleep. Most men preferred to work in winter rather then summer, because when they came home from work it was dark, but in summer it was too light and they had difficulty sleeping. During the day shift the men worked normal hours, but at night the timetable was very different. They clocked on at 9.30 p.m., had "morning break" at midnight. "Lunch" was about 3 a.m. The second break was about 5 a.m. and they left work at 7 a.m.
